data.name: Convert Celsius to Fahrenheit
data.description:
Test your fundamental arithmetic operator to operand prescedence knowledge while calculating (and returning) a temperature in degrees Fahrenheit given a temperature in degrees Celsius.

If a non-numerical input is provided, you should handle that by returning undefined.

The conversion formula goes as follows:

0 degrees Celsius is equal to 32 degrees Fahrenheit:

0 °C = 32 °F

The temperature T in degrees Fahrenheit (°F) is equal to the temperature T in degrees Celsius (°C) times 9/5 plus 32:

T(°F) = T(°C) × 9/5 + 32

Example

Convert 10 degrees Celsius to degrees Fahrenheit:

T(°F) = 10°C × 9/5 + 32 = 50 °F.
